document.ModsDocTitle: Description of a new species of the Ponerine ant genus, Emeyopone (Hymenoptera: Formicidae) from Karnataka, India.
document.masterDocTitle: Description of a new species of the Ponerine ant genus, Emeyopone (Hymenoptera: Formicidae) from Karnataka, India.

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of a new species of the Ponerine ant genus, Emeyopone (Hymenoptera: Formicidae) from Karnataka, India.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Emeryopone
Forel
, 1912 3: 761.
Type
species:
Emeryopone
buttelreepeni
, by monotypy.

Emeryopone
junior synonym
of
Belonopelta
:
Baroni
Urbani
1, 1975: 296.

Small
to medium size , mandibles long with 5-6 tooth, apical tooth unusually long, and broadly curved. Antennae 12 segmented with 3 segmented club . Eyes formed from one to ten ommatidia . Frontal lobes present.
Alitrunk
with well developed sutures . Petiole squamose with a well formed subpetiolar process . Hind tibia with a single pectinate spur . Body generally sculptured.

There are 5 species
of
Emeryopone
, known from
Sumatra
,
Nepal ,
Israel ,
China and India.

2.
Emeryopone
( Belonopelta )
franzi
(
Baroni
Urbani
*) 19755:305 ( w. ) ( Revived from synonymy5)

3.
Emeryopone
( Belonopelta )
loebli
(
Baroni
Urbani
1) 1975:307 ( w. ) ( Revived from synonymy5)
